intro: Securidaca engleriana, commonly known as the Engler's securidaca, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and South America. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in open woodlands and grasslands, thriving in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
